YUB.DESCRIPTION:
I started out doing my internship for the Web Application Development degree, but from day one I took on full-stack developer tasks, and continued in that role when I was hired after finishing the internship.

I worked on the complete development of an e-commerce platform built from scratch by the startup, which also served as the foundation for other clients, adapting its visual appearance through fine-tuned custom CSS for each one. My main responsibilities were:

  • - Developing new features such as an integrated blog system.
  • - Maintaining and improving the internal admin panel, also developed in-house.
  • - Deploying changes to both development and production environments, ensuring the stability of the project (for both the main project and multiple client projects).


It was an intense and formative period, where I had to figure things out on my own â€”literally learning by breaking stuffâ€”, but I came out much better prepared and with a clear vision of how to approach real projects in demanding environments.

ARATECH.DESCRIPTION:
I was initially hired to develop the frontend of a B2B e-commerce platform, working directly with the client (Econocom). The project was mainly developed with PHP and Prestashop.

After its completion, I became part of several internal projects at the consultancy, all developed in Angular. During my time there, I participated in applications from their early stages and was responsible for both implementing new features and improving existing ones in ongoing projects.
Agile methodologies in teams of 3-5 people.

ICP.DESCRIPTION:
